sections.title: Hit Points
sections.description: Hit Points are a measure of superficial harm and your character's poise and ability to avoid @Death.

sections.title: Death
sections.description: When you reach 0 @HitPoints, test @Fate. On success, you live with 1 hit point. On failure, you die.
sections.mechanics: Roll 1d10 against @Fate. If the roll is equal to or less than your @Fate score, you survive with 1 hit point. If your roll on the d10 is a 1, you restore all @Hitpoints

sections.title: Grit Teeth
sections.description: You take a 1-minute long respite from combat.

sections.title: Night's Rest
sections.description: A comfortable place to sleep (like an inn or farmer's barn) provides mental recovery.
benefits: Gain @Insight rerolls equal to your number of @Insight tokens

sections.title: Death Mechanics
sections.description: Once dead, you can choose to strike a feature from your character's sheet at any time and add value to a living player character of your choice. These abilities last until the start of the selected character's next turn.
examples: Strike off your late character's Body score, and replace a living character's tests with their Body score with a 1 until the start of their next turn
Give up each insight token and provide a living character a reroll on any test, before discarding the token
sections.timing: You can do these things at any time, even in response to dice rolls
